transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Hi there, this is Tansut, welcoming you to another sparkling episode of Space Ghost Coast to Coast! Tonight, strange British man Robin Leach, author Merrill Markoe, and British pop sensation Bananarama. And now, put your hands up to your face, and scream like a girl! (in high voice) It's Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings, y'all! I'm Space Ghost! Welcome to my incredibly entertaining comedy-style interview program, where anything can happen, and usually does. (band intro music) On tonight's big crazy-time joke show, legendary chronicler of high-livin' lifestyles Robin Leach, comedic author Merrill Markoe, and musical guest Bananarama, along with the usual gang of idiots, Zorak:

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Blah-diddy blah blah...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Blah-diddy blah.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Blah-diddy blah blah...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Blah-diddy blah.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Blah-diddy blah blah...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Stop it!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) Blah-diddy blah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Please welcome an old old old old old friend of mine, host of "Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous", Robin Leach!

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: (monitor lowers from ceiling) Spooky champagne wishes, and mysterious caviar dreams?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's a great pleasure to have you hear, Robin.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: I'm delighted, privileged, honoured. (image breaks up on monitor, with audio static)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, Robin? Moltar! Wake up back there, we're losing Robin!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (reading book, laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar? Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Whoops! (throws lever, image returns to normal)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, what happened, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I musta hit it with my knee or somethin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, try to be more careful in the future...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Just get off my back, man!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Alrighty! I'm here with Robin Leach! Thank you for joining us, Robin.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, thank you. May your nights be happy and long. But please take that cloak to the cleaners, will you? It's getting a little grey.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh-kay. (flies off) (bounds back instantly) Heh, forgot my wallet. (flies off again)

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: (looks annoyed)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The cleaners were closed, but I found this nice blouse in the gutter, and I have fashioned a hat out of a fry box.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: You need, um, you know, a tailored, more tailored look to yourself.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you suggesting a prosthetic abdominal augmentation enhancer?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Now you're talking, y'see?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Y'know, Robin, you should do a show on me.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Really. I wonder why...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because I have a lot of class. Just the other day, in fact, I went out and got myself a blender. It lets me blend.. just about anything!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beat!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Classy people are always blending stuff.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beat!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, I too can blend.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (sips his coffee) Beat!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It would be a good show! You think about it. (band plays a riff)

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Yes, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now Robin, all seriousness aside, congratulations on the incredible success of your show, you must be very proud.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Back in 1982-83, when we started this, uh, extraordinary show of looking at, uh, the richest people in the world, the most famous people in the world, everybody said we were nuts, we were crazy, we should be carted off and thrown away, um, by the men in the little white coats..

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: .. You probably know a few of the little men in the white coats, don't you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, uh, no. I .. don't .. know .. any .. little .. white .. men.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, you do, Space Ghost. You remember the nice men at the clinic.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (distraught) I'm not going back there, Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Okay, secretive. Secretive Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Citizen Robin, do the rich and famous require more oxygen than the average citizen?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: They require more of everything, they require more caviar, more champagne, and more gas...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And more cheese!

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: What they would do to get the secrets of your safe flight...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Would they take me to fancy places?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: ... and the speed of your flight, they would pay you millions of dollars!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Millions of dollars?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: In fact, there's a couple of multi-billionaires who've authorised me to try and slide some money under the table for you, to reveal your secrets to me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Power bands!

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Power bands. It begs the question, what is a power band?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: These things right here! They're for killin' villains! (does power band moves)

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Really. That's a little violent, isn't it, in this day and age when we should be seeking to get along with each other?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, me and Zorak get along pretty well. Don't we, Zorak? (shot of bandshell, sans Zorak) Where's Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Sorcerer
transcript.dialogue: He's not here, Chief.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where is he?

transcript.speaker: Sorcerer
transcript.dialogue: Eating musical guests Bananarama. (girls' screams in background) Hey, save some for me, daddy-o!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Robin, I have to apologize for the actions of my bandleader. He's quite a pill.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'd just get rid of him. I mean, I wouldn't, I'd just lay down the mantris killer, just...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (writing) Yes, lay, lay down the mantis killer, hmm mmm, yes...

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: You just pour powder around him in a circle, bring in the witches, and...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still writing) Witches, good.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: And poof, the magic dragon, gone. Just, just issue the threat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ya hear that, Zorak? Puff, the magic dragon!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I got your magic dragon, right here! See?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, hello there, magic dragon!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (watching "Skat Sandwich" video on control room monitor, with Space Ghost at his C2C desk dubbed in) What is this garbage? And why am I not in it?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Where's the, uh, where's the wine and champagne offer?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Excuse me?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Where do you keep it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Didn't you get the Vienna Sausage tray? That was for you!

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: This is it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, we had a little problem with the fridge, so...

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: I'm not interested in your problems, I'm interested in my stomach!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, look, Robin, we'll be finished up here in just a few minutes, and then we can all go out to dinner.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: I've been kept too long as it is. Now, where's the paycheque, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Er, the paycheck?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: You haven't been very gracious to me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now you listen to me, buddy boy! (pause)

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Surely Space Ghost is not stuck for words!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just gimme a second! Okay, I've got it. (ahem!) Now you listen to me, buddy boy...

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: Your talent booking department booked the wrong guest. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How do you mean?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: I am, in fact, Zoltran, and I have been kidding you all along.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gasps)

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: I have taken the identity of Robin Leach to fool you, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gasps)

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: And you have worked into my evil ugly trap.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gasps)

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: And now, in very quick order, I will raise my arms, cover myself, in black magic, and you are history!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gibbers)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Eh, that's funny! (Zoltran is on control room monitor, eyes no longer blasting Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, it looks like the "eyes" have it, but not for long, Zoltran! (Zoltran disappears from studio monitor, and is replaced by a test pattern) Moltar, what're you doin', I was about to blast Zoltran!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I couldn't let that happen. He's my... brother-in-law. (dramatic sting music)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Merrill Markoe is ready.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Merrill Markoe? Or Zoltran? (dramatic sting music)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I'm really sorry about that. Linda, she's...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Listen, Moltar, we can't have our guests being possessed by your freeloading brother-in-law.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I know, I know, but I promised my wife that...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't care what you promised, we obviously need to tighten security around here, because that is not gonna happen again!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever, brings up Merrill on control room monitor)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Wow, I'm in a satellite!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (studio monitor lowers from ceiling with Merrill) Halt, citizen!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Citizen?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Identify yourself!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Is that, by citizen, do you mean me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Identify yourself!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I thought you booked me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sarcastic) Maybe I did.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You don't know who I am?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sarcastic) Refresh my memory.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Refresh your memory... oh, great. (deep breath) Uh, Merrill Markoe is my name. And who are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm askin' the questions here!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Oh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you have proper identification?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Ah, yes, I certainly do.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, let's see it!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Getting carded! This happens to me on every one of these talk shows. (digs through her purse)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (impatient) Come on, come on, snap it up!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (pulls out picture ID, holds it up so Space Ghost can see)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (reading ID) Merrill Markoe... Okay, everything seems to check out. You can carry on.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (puts ID away) Now, do you always wear that, that hat?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's not a hat.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I can't see you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's a cowl.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: It's a who? A towel?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not a towel, a cowl. With a C.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Oh. Well, why don't you take it off, I can't see your eyes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But it hides my secret identity.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Oh, well, who cares what your secret identity is?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, me, for one.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: What are you protecting? What are you afraid of, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My personal life is very private and personal to me.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Well then, what are you doing on television?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) You know, Merrill, this interview should be more about you. Are you getting enough oxygen?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: No, I don't have a problem with that. Now, explain to me, where are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm... over here.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No, she means 'in space', stupid.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Like where, like relative to, say, Uranus, and Mars, would it be like to the left, the right, what?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ohhhhh... Over here, Merrill.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I don't think you have any idea where you are, or do you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I sure do!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You're asking me who I am, and you're asking me for information, and you have no idea where you are!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, um...

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: What kind of host are you?

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: (in control room, talking to Moltar, still green, as Zoltran) Did it work?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, Zoltran, it worked alright. I lost my parking space because of you, you jerk!

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: You run the show, so you have ultimate power.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, see, that's what Linda tells you! Do me a favor, and give me a call before you just decide to possess the body of one of our guests.

transcript.speaker: Robin Leach
transcript.dialogue: How do I get back, from here?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What, you gotta broken leg? Walk!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You don't, you don't breathe oxygen?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: For the last time, no.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: What exactly do you breathe?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, air.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You breathe air. It doesn't have oxygen in it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flustered) Sure, it has.. oxygen in it.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I don't think you have any idea what you're talkin' about, do you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just don't fluster me! You've got me all flustered!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Fluster him! Fluster him good!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Well, how old are you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Good one!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ohhh... Thirty.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Well, wait a minute now, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. Wait a minute, wait a minute. Space Ghost, you're thirty?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I thought you were a superhero in the sixties.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I was.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He was.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You were a superhero when you were born? Just, like as an infant, you were a superhero?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Exactly.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Right!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You couldn't have been a superhero, if you were a superhero in the sixties, you'd have to be pushing fifty.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: At least!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, (laughs) I'm not a math teacher.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You don't know the background, do you? You just don't know your own background.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am thirty years old.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You're not thirty.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am thirty years old.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You're closer to fifty, aren't you, Space Ghost? You're not thirty.

transcript.speaker: Puff
transcript.dialogue: Whoa, you're fifty?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What, me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Magic dragon, I'm gonna come over there and nail your magic feet to the floor!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Well, for a guy pushing fifty, I guess that's about as best as you can do.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever, starts credits rolling)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Are you actually a ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Of course I am. I'm Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: So does that mean you're deceased?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I, uh... yeah.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Do a lot of deceased people go into the talk show host kind of a field?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know what? I'm not deceased.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Alright, alright. Well, let's move on to something you can answer.
